Indoor sneakers required; bring water. Please follow all facility rules and staff directions. Pre-registration is strongly recommended. Walk-ins ONLY permitted if program is not at capacity. Currently Monday nights has openings. Walk-ins are only permitted for Monday. Ages Women 18+ Location Fairbank Community Center — Community Center Gym Fees $47 Residents • $52 Non-Residents (per 6-week session) Session Cycle This program runs in back-to-back 6-week sessions from fall through June . Exact start and end dates for each session are posted on MyRec at registration time. Holiday closures, elections, or facility needs may shift specific dates within a session; if that occurs, we will adjust the schedule to preserve your six nights of play. About the Program Join other women for weekly pick-up basketball in a friendly and welcoming environment. No league format—just show up, make teams, and play. Games organized on-site each week; rotating teams to keep play moving. Focus on fun, fitness, and sportsmanship. Indoor sneakers required; bring water. Personal basketball optional. Please follow all facility rules and staff directions. Pre-registration is strongly recommended. Minimum enrollment of 12 participants is required per session. Sessions that do not reach minimums may be canceled. Day-of registration is $10 per visit . Each class emphasizes safe range conduct, proper form, and steady skill progression—great for brand-new archers and returners. Program Snapshot Who: Ages 9–Adult (no prior experience required) Schedule: Fridays, 6:15–7:15 PM (various date ranges shown below) Coaches: USA Archery–certified instructors Equipment: All gear provided (recurve bows, arrows, arm guards) Format: Progressive lessons, safety briefings, guided target practice, and weekly challenges Session Length: Typically 5 weeks (see dates below) Skills & Benefits Fundamentals: stance, grip, anchor, aim, release, follow-through Consistent form and shot grouping to build accuracy and confidence Focus, patience, and body control in a supportive environment Creative archery games and mini-competitions for all levels Safety on the Range Strict range commands; arrows retrieved only on the coach’s signal Clear shooting lanes, coach-to-participant oversight, and fitted equipment Positive, technique-first coaching for all ages and abilities What to Bring / Wear Closed-toe athletic shoes Comfortable, fitted clothing (avoid loose sleeves/hood strings); Sudbury Park and Recreation Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Middle School Pick-Up Basketball • Register • View Cart • Friday Middle School Pick-Up Basketball — Winter & Spring 2026 Grades 6–8 • Fairbank Community Center Gym Schedule Winter: Fridays, Dec 19 – Mar 6 Spring: Fridays, Mar 13 - May 29 2025-2026 3:30 PM – 5:30 PM Fees $55 Residents • $65 Non-Residents Per Session per person Staff Coach Crow & Coach Aquino Capacity Max 25 participants We anticipate some absences, so this number makes sure we always have enough players for full games with rotations. About the Program A supervised, fun pick-up environment—no league pressure or formal coaching. Games are organized on-site each week with one coach/referee per court. No official scoring; focus on play, hustle, and sportsmanship. Participants must follow gym rules and demonstrate good behavior. Disruptive behavior may result in removal without return. Curtis Middle School Transportation to FCC Make arrival easy. This transportation option brings students from Curtis Middle School directly to the Fairbank Community Center for a prompt 3:30 PM start. Pick-Up: Curtis dismissal (~3:10 PM) Drop-Off: Fairbank Community Center (~3:25 PM) Fee & Seats: $3 per registered day — book by the day; max 12 seats (may add a second trip if demand is high) Important: Register for the correct day(s)/dates to match your program attendance. Limited seats; no walk-ins. Register for Curtis Middle School Transportation Optional Add-On: Dinner & Game Room Hang-Out with Coach Aquino Fridays, 5:30 PM – 7:30 PM • $20 per night • Runs with a minimum of 4 participants Rotating dinner themes (Burrito Night, Chick-fil-A Night, Custom Sub Night, and more). The full dinner schedule will be posted soon. Sudbury Park and Recreation Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Pickleball Membership Program • Register • View Cart • NO NEW MEMBERSHIPS AT THIS TIME - PLEASE JOIN WAIT-LIST (IF DAILY NUMBERS CALM-DOWN, WE WILL RE-OPEN) Pickleball Membership Program 2025–2026 Season Program Description Please read through the full information below to understand how memberships work, registration details, and seasonal guidelines. Season Dates: Tuesday, September 23, 2025 – Friday, April 17, 2026 Days: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday (No membership play on Wednesdays) Hours: 6:00 AM – 3:30 PM Location: Fairbank Community Center Gymnasium Eligibility: Adults age 18+ Note: Beginners are encouraged to take a clinic and have prior experience before participating in open play. Important: Schedule may be adjusted due to holidays, weather, elections, or building maintenance. Dates will be posted as they are confirmed. Membership Types & Pricing Choose from a full season or a monthly membership. Sudbury Resident: $300 Full Season / $48 Monthly Sudbury Resident 60+: $270 Full Season / $43 Monthly Price adjustment will happen at check-out automatically by age (60yo+). It won't display until you are checking out! Non-Resident: $350 Full Season / $55 Monthly Non-Resident 60+: $320 Full Season / $50 Monthly No drop-ins or day passes. Program Reminders No play on holidays, Town-observed holidays, or posted blackout dates No play on Wednesdays (we have Private Court Reservations & Clinics) Must scan in using your membership card at the front desk Round Robin rotation system and Code of Conduct posted in the gym & click here to read Round Robin/Conduct Code Clean court sneakers ONLY! We can all do our part in helping keep the courts clean and safe for all. No wet & salty sneakers! SENIOR DISCOUNT WILL BE APPLIED AT CHECK-OUT AUTOMATICALLY BY AGE! Refund Policy Refund requests must be made using our Refund Request Form, found on our website, and dated at least 7 business days prior to the start of the program. Refund request made at least 7 business days in advance of the program will be assessed a $10 withdrawal fee.  After 7 business days, no refunds will be granted. Refunds are easier to process if you pay by credit card. If more than three months have passed since your original credit card transaction your refund will be proceed by check. If you paid by check, you must submit a refund form with a copy of the cancelled check. Senior Discount SENIOR DISCOUNT WILL BE APPLIED AT CHECK-OUT AUTOMATICALLY BY AGE! This option is a one-time payment that secures your spot for the entire indoor season. We will reduce the full season fee slightly each month as the season progresses.

Monthly Recurring Membership:
This flexible plan is designed for those who prefer not to commit to the full season. It automatically renews each month unless you cancel. Starts on the day you register. 

Please note:
If you cancel a monthly plan, we cannot guarantee space will be available should you wish to rejoin later.

Non-residents are welcome to register beginning September 15, only if space permits. We won’t know availability for non-residents until resident registration has closed. Refund Policy Refund requests must be made using our Refund Request Form, found on our website, and dated at least 7 business days prior to the start of the program. Refund request made at least 7 business days in advance of the program will be assessed a $10 withdrawal fee.  After 7 business days, no refunds will be granted. Refunds are easier to process if you pay by credit card. If more than three months have passed since your original credit card transaction your refund will be proceed by check. If you paid by check, you must submit a refund form with a copy of the cancelled check. Senior Discount SENIOR DISCOUNT WILL BE APPLIED AT CHECK-OUT AUTOMATICALLY BY AGE! This option is a one-time payment that secures your spot for the entire indoor season. We will reduce the full season fee slightly each month as the season progresses.

Monthly Recurring Membership:
This flexible plan is designed for those who prefer not to commit to the full season. It automatically renews each month unless you cancel. Starts on the day you register. 

Please note:
If you cancel a monthly plan, we cannot guarantee space will be available should you wish to rejoin later.

Non-residents are welcome to register beginning September 15, only if space permits. We won’t know availability for non-residents until resident registration has closed. Program Snapshot Where: Fairbank Community Center – Community Center Gym (40 Fairbank Rd, Sudbury, MA) Format: Round-robin rotation (self-managed with on-site guidance) Session Length: 6 weeks (fall blocks typically run 5–6 weeks) Capacity: Max 21 players per time slot Thursday Night Pickleball Day/Time: Thursdays, 6:00 PM – 8:00 PM Skill Level: Intermediate+ (you know the rules, have some experience, and play occasionally) Max Participants: 21 Format: Round-robin rotation; keep matches moving and rotate promptly Saturday Morning Pickleball Session 1: 9:00 AM – 11:00 AM — Intermediate+ Session 2: 11:15 AM – 1:15 PM — Open Level Max Participants (each session): 21 Format: Round-robin rotation; fair, quick court changes How Rotations Work Check in at the front desk on the digital pad before stepping on court. One person registers for the whole group (up to 6 players ), and you’ll have a dedicated court for your entire reservation — an easy way to play with your own group without open-play rotations. Quick Facts Fees $25 Resident • $35 Non-Resident Pickleball Program Members: 25% off Group Size Up to 6 players per court One registrant reserves on behalf of the entire group. What’s Included One (1) court + one (1) net Bring your own paddles and balls. Location & Check-In Fairbank Community Center — Community Center Gym Please check in at the front desk before entering the gym. Available Time Blocks 6:00–7:30 AM 7:30–9:00 AM small gap for pre-k soccer 9:30–11:00 AM If a time shows Full , it isn’t available. You can select as many future dates as you’d like — please double-check the exact date(s) before completing checkout. How It Works 1) One Person Registers Reserve a single court for your group (max 6 players). The registrant pays the full session fee; no additional checkouts needed for guests. 2) Arrive & Check In Head to the Parks & Rec desk to check in. Staff will confirm your reservation and court assignment. 3) Play Your Session Enjoy your private court for the full reserved time with no rotations . Play only with your group, and please finish on time so the next group can begin promptly. Notes & Policies Member Discount 25% off for current Sudbury Rec Pickleball Program members. Log into your MyRec account; eligible discounts apply at checkout. You won’t see the discount until checkout. Footwear & Equipment Clean, non-marking indoor shoes required. Bring your own paddles and balls (net provided). Water only in the gym; no food permitted. Use Guidelines Private recreational use only; no paid instruction or subletting. Max 6 players per court. Please respect staff directions and posted gym rules. Scheduling Available dates/times are posted online. If a slot shows Full , it’s not available. You may select multiple future dates in one checkout — please double-check the date(s) you’ve selected before paying. Cancellations: account credit may be issued; cancellations made at least 7 business days in advance are eligible per policy. Questions? Contact Sudbury Parks & Recreation at recreation@sudbury.ma.us or 978-443-1092. Links: cancelations and refund policy How to register for programs, click here to review the video. Sudbury Park and Recreation Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Marcus Lewis Pickleball Coaching • Register • View Cart • Marcus Lewis Pickleball Coaching Program Fairbank Community Center • Community Center Gym (Court #3) Progressive, high-quality instruction for adult players. Sessions are grouped by ability, so everyone learns at the right pace in a supportive environment. Use the level guide below to choose your best fit, then select a registration option at the bottom (dates/times/fees are listed in the registration lines). Note: Schedule may adjust due to weather, elections, or building maintenance. Loaner paddles and balls are available. Introductory Pickleball Coaching (Beginner) Brand-new players or those returning after a long break. Learn rules, court layout, scoring, safe movement, grip/stance, and core strokes (serve, return, forehand, backhand). Simple progressions with lots of guided reps in a welcoming setting. Outcome: Comfort with basics and readiness for friendly open play. 2.5 Advanced-Beginner Pickleball Coaching You know the fundamentals and want consistency. Build reliable serve/return, cleaner contact, footwork and positioning, and controlled dinks. Intro to third-shot options and simple doubles communication and rotation. Outcome: Longer rallies and confident participation in social doubles. 3.0 Low-Intermediate Pickleball Coaching Solidify patterns and shot selection. Emphasis on third-shot drop vs. drive, transition footwork to the kitchen, sustained dinking, soft resets, and opportunistic attacking. Scenario-based points with feedback on court coverage and teamwork. Outcome: Execute core patterns reliably and convert more points at the kitchen. 3.5 Intermediate Pickleball Coaching For experienced players aiming to sharpen tactics. Pace control, resets from the mid-court, targeted third shots, reading and countering speed-ups, baiting, stacking/switching, and smarter positioning. High-rep drill blocks plus coached, situational play. Outcome: Higher conversion in fast exchanges and league/tournament play. Drills Pickleball Coaching (All Level) Fast-paced stations to maximize touches: ball-fed sequences, serve/return ladders, third-shot repetitions, transition volleys, hand-speed games, and short coached play. Great add-on for any level to build mechanics and conditioning. Outcome: Sharper mechanics, better stamina, and skills that carry into match play. Coached Round Robin Play (3-Week Session) A fun hybrid of play and instruction! Players rotate through matches while receiving live, on-court coaching. Coaches offer in-game feedback on positioning, shot selection, and tactics during real-time play. Perfect for those ready to test their skills under expert guidance. Outcome: Improved court awareness, smarter decision-making, and confidence in match situations. Who: Adults 17+  • Where: Fairbank Community Center Gym (Side B / Court #3)  • How to Register: Choose your level above, then select your preferred session from the registration options below (dates/times/fees are shown in the registration lines). Sessions are grouped by ability, so everyone learns at the right pace in a supportive environment. Use the level guide below to choose your best fit, then select a registration option at the bottom (dates/times/fees are listed in the registration lines). Note: Schedule may adjust due to weather, elections, or building maintenance. Loaner paddles and balls are available. Introductory Pickleball Coaching (Beginner) Brand-new players or those returning after a long break. Learn rules, court layout, scoring, safe movement, grip/stance, and core strokes (serve, return, forehand, backhand). Simple progressions with lots of guided reps in a welcoming setting. Outcome: Comfort with basics and readiness for friendly open play. 2.5 Advanced-Beginner Pickleball Coaching You know the fundamentals and want consistency. Build reliable serve/return, cleaner contact, footwork and positioning, and controlled dinks. Intro to third-shot options and simple doubles communication and rotation. Outcome: Longer rallies and confident participation in social doubles. 3.0 Low-Intermediate Pickleball Coaching Solidify patterns and shot selection. Emphasis on third-shot drop vs. drive, transition footwork to the kitchen, sustained dinking, soft resets, and opportunistic attacking. Scenario-based points with feedback on court coverage and teamwork. Outcome: Execute core patterns reliably and convert more points at the kitchen. 3.5 Intermediate Pickleball Coaching For experienced players aiming to sharpen tactics. Pace control, resets from the mid-court, targeted third shots, reading and countering speed-ups, baiting, stacking/switching, and smarter positioning. High-rep drill blocks plus coached, situational play. Outcome: Higher conversion in fast exchanges and league/tournament play. Drills Pickleball Coaching (All Level) Fast-paced stations to maximize touches: ball-fed sequences, serve/return ladders, third-shot repetitions, transition volleys, hand-speed games, and short coached play. Great add-on for any level to build mechanics and conditioning. Outcome: Sharper mechanics, better stamina, and skills that carry into match play. Coached Round Robin Play (3-Week Session) A fun hybrid of play and instruction! Players rotate through matches while receiving live, on-court coaching. Coaches offer in-game feedback on positioning, shot selection, and tactics during real-time play. Perfect for those ready to test their skills under expert guidance. Outcome: Improved court awareness, smarter decision-making, and confidence in match situations. Who: Adults 17+  • Where: Fairbank Community Center Gym (Side B / Court #3)  • How to Register: Choose your level above, then select your preferred session from the registration options below (dates/times/fees are shown in the registration lines). Town of Acton Recreation Department Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Facilities Facility List General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Facilities Facility List General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Register Now Skip to nav Adult Pickleball Class Description Introductory Pickleball Class (Beginner) This class is designed for newcomers to pickleball or players with limited experience. It covers the basic fundamentals of the game, including rules, court layout, and scoring. Players will learn how to hold the paddle, proper stance, and basic strokes such as the forehand, backhand, and serve. Emphasis is placed on developing hand-eye coordination, understanding the rules of play, and building confidence. The class is fun, relaxed, and intended to make new players feel comfortable with the game. Novice Pickleball Class This class is for players who have a solid understanding of the basic rules and techniques and are ready to refine their skills. Players will focus on improving consistency, footwork, and positioning. The class will delve into more advanced strokes like the third-shot drop, dinking, and the volley game at the net. There will be an emphasis on strategic play, including understanding when to attack or defend and improving communication with a partner in doubles play. Intermediate Pickleball Class Designed for players with significant experience and who are comfortable with the basic and intermediate techniques of the game. In this class, players will focus on advanced tactics, advanced shot selections, and developing a deeper understanding of strategy. The class will cover complex drills that challenge control, speed, and accuracy, as well as incorporating mental aspects of the game, like anticipation and reading the opponent's moves. Participants will have the opportunity to participate in competitive match play with feedback from the instructor. Return to Programs View All Activities Share This Page:

Town of Acton Recreation Department Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Facilities Facility List General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Store Facilities Facility List General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Town Site Register Now Skip to nav Archery:  On the Mark Archery • Register • View Cart • Unlock the art of precision focus with our inclusive archery classes, suitable for both kids and adults alike. Led by experienced instructors, our program offers a welcoming environment for participants of all ages and skill levels to explore this timeless sport. From mastering the basics of stance and posture to refining aim and accuracy, each session blends expert guidance with hands-on practice, ensuring every archer can progress at their own pace. Whether you're a young enthusiast eager to embark on a new adventure, or an adult seeking a rewarding hobby, this program provides the perfect opportunity to develop confidence, discipline and camaraderie while honing your skill. Archery with On the Mark! (Youths) Learn the Olympic sport of archery and build confidence, self-esteem and focus. Using beautiful wooden recurve bows, this martial art has mental and physical health benefits to help children succeed on and off the range. Weekly lesson plans balance skill with friendly competition. Grades 4 and up Archery with On the Mark! (Adults) Release stress with arrows! Relax after the work day with this low-impact program. Archery is an Olympic sport and is nationally one of the fastest growing.  It is easy to learn, but challenging to master. The thrill of shooting a bow is unlike any other body/mind sensation, involving elements and strategy similar to golf, yoga, martial arts and even chess! Ages 14 and up All equipment provided and class is led by teams of certified USA Archery instructors. Please wear closed-toe footwear and bring a filled water bottle. REFUNDS & WITHDRAWAL S: You may withdraw from a program up to 7 (seven) business days prior to the start date— a non-refundable administrative fee of $25 will be applied to each registration . After that time, no refunds will be issued. Administrative Fees are non-refundable. All requests must be submitted in writing to the Recreation Department requesting cancellation. Refund requests are not accepted through instructors. Refunds by check require several weeks to process. Refunds will not be made for classes missed due to weather. Exception to refund policy timeframe: Written letter from a licensed physician excusing participant from a program prior to first class . Please note that our hours may change periodically to accommodate NHS Athletics. This will be communicated as far in advance as is possible. Norfolk Recreation Register Programs Search Activities Store Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Community Orgs Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Store Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Community Orgs Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Adult Exercise with Nanci • Register • View Cart • The Combo Class 1/2-Hour Strength & 1/2-Hour Pilates MONDAYS: 6:30 - 7:30 PM 9/8, 9/15, 9/22, 9/29, 10/6, (NO 10/13), 10/20, 10/27, 11/3, 11/10, 11/17, 11/24, 12/1 WEDNESDAYS 6:30 - 7:30 PM 9/10, 9/17, 9/24, 10/1, 10/8, 10/15, 10/22, 10/29, 11/5, 11/12, 11/19, (NO 11/26), 12/3 FRIDAYS 8:30 - 9:30 AM 9/12, 9/19, 9/26, 10/3, 10/10, 10/17, 10/24, 10/31, 11/7, 11/14, 11/21, (NO 11/28), 12/5 This class has the benefits of both strength training and Pilates! The class consists of a half hour of strength training and a half hour of Pilates. Weights are provided. Please bring a towel or mat. Ladies Light Hike Time: 9:45am - 11:00am Fall Session 1: THURSDAYS: 9/4, 9/11, 9/18, 9/25, 10/2, 10/9 And/Or SATURDAYS: 9/6, 9/13, 9/20, 9/27, 10/4, 10/11 Fall Session 2: THURSDAYS: 10/23, 10/30, 11/6, 11/13, 11/20, (NO 11/27), 12/4 And/Or SATURDAYS: 10/25, 11/1, 11/8, 11/15, 11/22, (NO 11/29), 12/6 Add dimensions to your walking or jogging! Do you like the idea of hiking but don’t want to go alone? Hiking is fantastic exercise as well as a great time to get some fresh air and explore new places. This class moves at a good pace - we’ll be looking for hills! We will meet at various local locations every week (a list will be given distributed). Happy Dogs Hike Time: 10:30 - 11:30 AM Fall Session 1: FRIDAYS:  9/12, 9/19, 9/26, 10/3, 10/10, 10/17 Fall Session 2: FRIDAYS: 10/24, 10/31, 11/7, 11/14, 11/21, (NO 11/28), 12/5 Hike with your “best friend”! Join other dog owners in this popular group exercise! Dogs, just like humans, are social beings. Regular playdates with other dogs are an important part of your dog’s wellbeing. Let’s get together for some fresh air and a romp through the woods with your dog. Bring a leash, pick-up bags and water for your dog. No aggressive dogs please! Locations for Ladies Light Hike & Dog Hike Locations vary each week. The 1st meeting is at F. Gilbert State Forest, 45 Mill Street, Foxborough, MA Park at the Meeting House Chapel. Other locations will be given out at the first meeting . Often called a physical game of chess, fencing develops endurance, coordination, agility, poise and balance. While fencing is a physical sport, it is also a mental game requiring concentration, quick decision-making and problem-solving. It’s an ideal activity for people of all ages and sizes. About the Instructor: Michael Tarascio was a member of the United States World Championship Team in Men's Foil. Michael is a Level 4 Foil coach certified through the United States Fencing Association. Also, certified through the Positive Coaching Alliance and the American Sports Education Program. He teaches Recreational Classes for Youth, Teens, and Adults. Michael also teaches Advanced Level Technique and Tactics Classes and provides Individual Coaching for the Serious Competitive Fencer. Michael's philosophy on fencing is: "Participate in fencing because it's fun." Fencing Equipment Purchase and Rental Information will be sent out prior to class. For more information, contact Michael at 978 -210-2711 or michael@nefencing.com . EQUIPMENT POLICY & FENCING GEAR REQUIREMENTS ALL Participants must have fencing equipment to participate. Option 1: Purchasing new Michael recommends Absolute Fencing Gear, Inc. https://www.absolutefencinggear.com/shopping/ Michael is available at michael@nefencing.com to help. Option 2: Rental from Coach Michael $50.00 plus a $100.00 deposit for an 8-week session. At the end of the last class, the deposit will be issued upon returning the fencing gear to Coach Michael.  He will set up appointments for you and your fencer in 15-minute slots for those who need rental fencing gear. Fencers will be fitted for equipment. Fencers will take the equipment home with them.
